sections.title: Dental Implants in Shoreham-by-Sea
sections.body: Secure, natural-looking tooth replacements planned precisely for lasting comfort.
bullets: Consultations that map your goals before any surgery
Digital planning to protect bone and soft tissue
Restorations shaped to blend with nearby teeth

sections.title: Calm, evidence-led implant care
items: Every case mapped with CBCT imaging and 3D implant planning software
Surgical guides designed for your anatomy before any visit to theatre
Close collaboration with labs for shade, shape, and bite harmony
Clear aftercare with direct lines back to the clinical team

sections.title: Scan-led planning for every implant
sections.body: Implants are only placed after a full clinical assessment and CBCT scan, followed by 3D planning software that positions the implant within your bone, nerves, and planned restoration. We share the plan with you before treatment and link to your implant consultation (/treatments/implant-consultation) if you want to review next steps in more detail.
bullets: CBCT scan plus digital impressions to map bone, soft tissue, and bite
3D planning software to align the implant with your final crown or bridge
Guide design and fabrication in-house so you can see how precision is built in

sections.title: Titanium foundations that feel like your own teeth
sections.body: Implants replace a tooth root with a small titanium post that bonds with bone, supporting a crown, bridge, or denture that looks and feels secure.

sections.title: Support for single or multiple missing teeth
items: Single gaps where neighbouring teeth stay untouched
Several missing teeth needing a stable bridge
Full-arch solutions when dentures feel loose
Patients wanting to protect jaw bone volume

sections.title: What to expect: scan, plan, guided placement
items: Scan: CBCT imaging and digital records to understand bone, nerves, and the space for your new tooth
Plan: 3D implant positioning with a custom surgical guide designed and printed in-house
Place: measured, often flapless placement under local anaesthetic, with healing checks and clear aftercare (/treatments/implant-aftercare)
sections.strapline: Timelines vary. Healing, bone quality, and your medical history guide whether we stage treatment or progress more quickly.

sections.title: Guided surgery with 3D-printed surgical guides
sections.body: We design and 3D print your surgical guide in-house so implant positioning follows the digital plan precisely. Sleeved guidance helps us avoid key anatomy, manage angulation, and deliver the planned depth while keeping tissue handling as gentle as possible.

sections.title: Why guided implant surgery matters
items: Predictable positioning that supports long-term stability
Measured angulation to avoid nerves and sinus spaces
Often flapless or minimally invasive for less trauma and fewer stitches
Calmer appointments with shorter chair time and faster recovery
Comfort-focused aftercare to protect healing and implant longevity

sections.title: Healing support with clear check-ins
items: Written guidance on cleaning around the implant site
Regular reviews to monitor healing and bite comfort
Advice on diet and activity while tissues settle, including when to adjust routines after guided, often minimally invasive placement
Transparent discussion of risks like soreness or implant movement, plus individual candidacy, consent, and safety checks before proceeding

faqs.question: Why use CBCT and 3D planning for implants?
faqs.answer: A CBCT scan shows bone, nerves, and sinus spaces in 3D. Planning software lets us position the implant within that anatomy and the planned crown, increasing accuracy before surgery.

faqs.question: What is a 3D-printed surgical guide?
faqs.answer: It’s a custom template designed from your scan that directs implant angulation, depth, and position. We design and print guides in-house to follow the digital plan precisely.

faqs.question: Does guided surgery heal faster?
faqs.answer: Guided placement often allows flapless or minimally invasive techniques, which can mean less swelling and fewer stitches. Healing still varies by bone quality and overall health.

faqs.question: Am I suitable for guided implants?
faqs.answer: Suitability depends on bone volume, gum health, bite forces, and medical history. We confirm this during your implant consultation (/treatments/implant-consultation) and may advise preparatory care first.

faqs.question: How long do guided implants last?
faqs.answer: Implants are intended for long-term use. Longevity depends on healing, home care, attending reviews, and following aftercare guidance (/treatments/implant-aftercare).

faqs.question: What support is there after surgery?
faqs.answer: You receive written aftercare, review appointments, and hygiene guidance. We also discuss comfort options, including sedation (/treatments/sedation-dentistry) if anxiety makes visits difficult.

faqs.question: Will I have a temporary tooth while it heals?
faqs.answer: In many cases we provide a provisional crown or denture so you can smile and chew gently while the implant integrates.

sections.title: Nearly 30 years of restorative and implant experience
sections.body: Your implant care is led by a clinician who graduated in 1998 (BDS, King’s), holds an MSc in Restorative & Aesthetic Dentistry, and a PGDip in Orthodontics & Facial Orthopaedics. Training includes a year-long implant surgical course plus intensive implant placement training in Cairo (2014), supporting balanced judgement across planning, surgery, and long-term maintenance.
bullets: 1998 dental graduate with almost three decades of clinical experience
Focus on restorative harmony so implants blend with surrounding teeth
Guided surgery skills strengthened through structured implant programs
Ongoing learning to combine 3D planning, surgery, and restorative outcomes

sections.title: Book an Implant Consultation & Planning
sections.strapline: See how CBCT-led planning, in-house 3D printing, and guided placement can support a predictable result. Explore aftercare (/treatments/implant-aftercare) and digital dentistry (/treatments/3d-digital-dentistry) resources too.
